revised_title: Neutron-Induced Gold Isotope Activity and Its Y-Radiation Properties
tldr: The author studied the 2.7-day activity in gold isotope 198Au by using a / 7-spectrometer and a special technique for studying y-radiation. They found that gold irradiated with slow neutrons has a strong activity with a half-life of 2.7 days, which must be due to the gold isotope 198Au. The author also investigated the y-radiation properties and the / 7-spectrum, discovering only one y-ray of medium energy (0.401 MeV) following the / 7-disintegration.
